author: James R. Hagerty
title: Amsale Aberra Designed Wedding Gowns With an Understated Elegance
text:
Amsale Aberra was a foreign student studying commercial art in Vermont in 1974 when Emperor Haile Selassie, the leader of her homeland of Ethiopia, was toppled from power. In the ensuing turmoil, her father, a government official, was imprisoned.
Cut off from financial support, Ms. Aberra took on menial jobs. One was at a Jack in the Box hamburger stand, where she was swiftly fired after managers found she was so shy and soft-spoken that the chefs couldnâ€™t hear the orders she was supposed to shout to them. Ms. Aberra found...
